AP Photo
By Nick Gass
8/18/15 2:51 PM EDT
Former President Jimmy Carter will discuss his cancer diagnosis at a news conference on Thursday in Atlanta, according to press guidance provided by the Carter Center.
Carter, 90, announced last week that recent surgery to remove a small mass in his liver revealed that cancer has spread to other parts of the body.
Story Continued Below
“I will be rearranging my schedule as necessary so I can undergo treatment by physicians at Emory Healthcare,” Carter said in a statement last Wednesday.
The news conference is scheduled to begin at 10 a.m. local time and last for approximately 45 minutes, according to the media advisory.
By MATT LATIMER

title: Jimmy Carter to discuss cancer diagnosis Thursday
